world

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    World is a class used to handle the game world graphics

    The World class use the Scenery objects (or the objects implementing the Scenery class) to display images of several objects corresponding to trees and traps and so on

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Scenery[][] map
      Two-dimensional array containing all objects within the world This object is filled using a file in the root directory and in the form of map[x][y] from top-left to right-bottom
      protected int sizeX
      Horizontal size of the map
      protected int sizeY
      Vertical size of the map
      protected boolean visible
      Boolean equals to true if the world is visible, false is the world is not

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      World(java.lang.String filename, java.awt.Graphics g, int canvasHeight, int canvasWidth)
      World class constructor

        protected boolean visible
        Boolean equals to true if the world is visible, false is the world is not

      • sizeX

        Horizontal size of the map

      • map

        protected Scenery[][] map
        Two-dimensional array containing all objects within the world

        This object is filled using a file in the root directory and in the form of map[x][y] from top-left to right-bottom

      • World

        public World(java.lang.String filename,
     java.awt.Graphics g,
     int canvasHeight,
     int canvasWidth)
        World class constructor
        Parameters:
        filename - filename containing the data of the current map
        g - Graphics object used to draw the world
        canvasHeight - Height of the canvas in which we draw the world
        canvasWidth - Widht of the canvas in which we draw the world
